name: Enticing World History Online Quiz | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: What city, built on the Tigris river, was the capital of Assyria?
questions.explanation:
Nineveh.

	The site of Nineveh is located in modern day Iraq.

questions.text: Which bishop of Alexandria helped suppress the Arian heresy of the early Catholic church?
questions.explanation:
Athanasius.

	Alexandria is located in modern day Egypt.

questions.text: What was the name of the German president who invited Hitler to become Chancellor in 1933?
questions.explanation:
Hindenburg.

	Paul von Hindenberg became the elected German president in 1925.

questions.text: What was the name of the last dynasty in Hawaii prior to the republic?
questions.explanation:
Kamehameha.

	Kamehameha was also the name of one of Hawaii's greatest kings.

questions.text: Who was the first president of Kenya, beginning in 1964?
questions.explanation:
Jomo Kenyatta.

	Kenya was previously ruled by the British.

questions.text: Although most people give Magellan credit for the world's first circumnavigation, some believe it was this man, who returned Magellan's ship, the Victoria, back to Spain following Magellan's death in the Philippines. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Juan Sebastián Elcano.

	Magellan was killed at the Battle of Mactan on tiny Mactan Island off the coast of Cebu.

questions.text: One of the greatest Chinese novels is called 'Hong Lou Meng' or 'Dream of the Red Chamber.' By what name is it alternately called?
options: The Romance of the Three Kindoms
questions.explanation:
The Story of the Stone.

	Cao Xueqin was the author of this 18th century work.

questions.text: Along with the Sioux, which other major Native American tribe participated in the Battle of Little Big Horn, in which Custer was defeated?
questions.explanation:
Cheyenne.

	The Battle of Little Big Horn took place in what is now Montana.

questions.text: Who was the prime minister of South Africa following World War I (beginning 1919), and during World War II?
questions.explanation:
Smuts.

	Jan Christian Smuts resisted calls for the official establishment of Apartheid, though de facto, many Apartheid policies were already in existence.

questions.text: What was the name of the white mule of Mohammed, founder of Islam?
questions.explanation:
Fadda.

	The name Mohammed means 'the praised one'. Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope you have enjoyed it.
